metadata.title: CVE-2020-26969 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 82. Someof these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrarycode. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
